Multi-threaded
Java Web Server

A lightweight, high-performance HTTP web server built from scratch using Project Loom's virtual threads for efficient concurrency and modern web serving.

Powerful Features

Built with modern Java technologies and best practices for maximum performance and scalability.

Virtual Threads

Leverages Project Loom's virtual threads for handling thousands of concurrent connections with minimal resource overhead.

File Serving

Serves static files from configurable directories with proper MIME type detection and directory listing capabilities.

Gzip Compression

Automatic compression for text-based files when client supports it, reducing bandwidth usage significantly.

Security

Built-in protection against directory traversal attacks and proper input validation for secure file serving.

Modular Design

Clean separation of concerns with dedicated classes for request handling, response generation, and file serving.

Zero Dependencies

Pure Java implementation with no external frameworks or libraries required for maximum simplicity and control.

Quick Start

Get your server running in minutes with these simple commands.

terminal 
# Clone and compile
git clone https://github.com/foskey51/web-server.git
cd web-server
gradle build

# Create sample files (if needed)
mkdir dist
echo "<h1>Hello World!</h1>" > dist/index.html

# Run the server
gradle run --args"8080 ../dist"
